intro: Rudbeckia digitata, commonly known as the black-eyed Susan, is a flowering plant native to North America. It is characterized by its yellow ray flowers surrounding a central dark brown disk, giving it its common name. The plant typically grows to a height of 1 to 3 feet and thrives in full sun to partial shade. Its leaves are lance-shaped and hairy, providing a textured appearance. Rudbeckia digitata is a hardy perennial that is well-suited for garden landscapes due to its resilience and vibrant floral display.
